result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice E Davis

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Grant D Scaife in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice E Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen in court for Maurice E Davis. 
State has documentation for signatures for Waiver of Extradition. 
Documents signed by all parties.
Court gives verbal colloquy to Deft on the record, finds valid waiver and will sign Extradition documents.
Documents placed in sealed envelopes by the State, provided to all parties and copy given to Bailiff.

4:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice E Davis appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by phone for Maurice E Davis. 
Atty Derksen - Deft would like to waive Extradition Hearing.
Court unable to accommodate today, will need to be set for in person appearance.
Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Extradition hearing on July 22, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

11:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maurice E Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe appeared by video for Maurice E Davis. Court goes off record to receive warrant. 
RECALLED: 11:52 AM Appearances the same. Given complaint & warrant-Advised of Rights-Bond set-NG plea entered-Probable cause found-Extradition hearing requested.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Extradition hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
